title.value: GAUCHE: A Library for Gaussian Processes in Chemistry
title.justification: The title of the paper is provided at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: GAUCHE: A Library for Gaussian Processes in Chemistry

extractions.description: The paper introduces GAUCHE, a library designed to extend Gaussian processes to chemical representations such as graphs, strings, and bit vectors. It aims to enhance tools for uncertainty quantification and Bayesian optimization in chemistry, and provides GPU-based implementations of various kernels for these tasks. The paper also details applications in molecular discovery and chemical reaction optimization.

type.justification: The paper conducts benchmark experiments evaluating the utility of the GAUCHE library on regression, uncertainty quantification, and Bayesian optimization tasks, making it an empirical study.
type.quote: We conduct benchmark experiments evaluating the utility of the GP framework on regression, uncertainty quantification and BO tasks.

name.justification: The paper focuses on applying Gaussian processes to chemical representations, which is a key aspect of chemoinformatics.
name.quote: By defining such kernels in GAUCHE, we seek to open the door to powerful tools for uncertainty quantification and Bayesian optimisation in chemistry.

name.justification: The paper involves machine learning methods tailored for molecular property prediction and reaction yield prediction.
name.quote: Gaussian processes have long been a cornerstone of probabilistic machine learning, affording particular advantages for uncertainty quantification and Bayesian optimisation.

name.justification: Bayesian optimization is a key application discussed in the paper for optimizing chemical reactions and molecular properties.
name.quote: The iterative model refitting required in BO makes it a prime example of such an automated task.

name.justification: BNNs are mentioned as an existing surrogate model used for uncertainty estimates in BO and AL.
name.quote: To date in molecular machine learning, Bayesian neural networks (BNNs) have been the surrogate of choice to produce the uncertainty estimates that underpin BO and AL.

is_contributed.justification: BNNs are referenced as an existing technology and not a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: To date in molecular machine learning, Bayesian neural networks (BNNs) have been the surrogate of choice to produce the uncertainty estimates that underpin BO and AL.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not mention executing or experimenting with Bayesian Neural Networks.
is_executed.quote: To date in molecular machine learning, Bayesian neural networks (BNNs) have been the surrogate of choice to produce the uncertainty estimates that underpin BO and AL.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not compare BNNs numerically to other models; it only references them as existing methods.
is_compared.quote: To date in molecular machine learning, Bayesian neural networks (BNNs) have been the surrogate of choice to produce the uncertainty estimates that underpin BO and AL.

referenced_paper_title.value: A benchmark study on reliable molecular supervised learning via Bayesian learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper 'A benchmark study on reliable molecular supervised learning via Bayesian learning' is cited when discussing BNNs.

name.justification: GNNs are mentioned as a potential future direction for kernel development in the GAUCHE framework.
name.quote: Gaussian processes comprise kernel hyperparameters, θ in addition to the likelihood noise, σy2...Pretrained graph neural networks (GNNs) (Hu et al., 2019) may also be used to embed molecular graphs.

is_contributed.justification: GNNs are referenced as existing models in the context of potential use in GAUCHE, not as a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Pretrained graph neural networks (GNNs) (Hu et al., 2019) may also be used to embed molecular graphs in a vector space.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not mention executing or experimenting with GNNs.
is_executed.quote: Pretrained graph neural networks (GNNs) (Hu et al., 2019) may also be used to embed molecular graphs in a vector space.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not compare GNNs numerically to other models; it discusses them as a potential future direction.
is_compared.quote: Pretrained graph neural networks (GNNs) (Hu et al., 2019) may also be used to embed molecular graphs.

name.justification: The dataset is explicitly mentioned in the context of evaluating GP models in the GAUCHE framework.
name.quote: The Photoswitch Dataset: (Thawani et al., 2020): The labels, y are the experimentally-determined values of the E isomer π − π* transition wavelength for 392 photoswitch molecules.

name.justification: GPyTorch is mentioned as a fundamental library used for implementing GAUCHE.
name.quote: Furthermore, GAUCHE includes support for protein and chemical reaction representations and interfaces with the GPyTorch (Gardner et al., 2018) and BoTorch (Balandat et al., 2020) libraries to facilitate usage for advanced probabilistic modelling and BO.

name.justification: BoTorch is mentioned as a fundamental library used for implementing GAUCHE.
name.quote: Furthermore, GAUCHE includes support for protein and chemical reaction representations and interfaces with the GPyTorch (Gardner et al., 2018) and BoTorch (Balandat et al., 2020) libraries to facilitate usage for advanced probabilistic modelling and BO.

name.justification: RDKit is mentioned as a fundamental library used for implementing GAUCHE.
name.quote: We propose a GP framework for molecules and chemical reactions. We provide an open-source, GPU-enabled library building on GPyTorch, BoTorch and RDKit to facilitate usage for advanced probabilistic modeling and BO.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper 'RDKit: Open-source cheminformatics' is cited when discussing RDKit.
